div.p: THE True Copie of an Edict, made by the King of Spaine, concerning the new Chriſtians Dwelling in Portugall, and of their departure out of his ſaide Realmes & Dominions, freely without moleſtation, or loſſe of their goodes, and alſo of free libertie to them graunted, for their returne againe into his Realmes and Dominions: whenſoever they ſhall thinke good.
Tranſlated out of the Portugall language, into Engliſh. 1602.
❧ At LONDON, Printed by R. B. for Thomas Pauier.

div.head: A True Copie of the King of Spaines late Edict, touching the Chriſtians &c.
div.p:
by the grace of God, I giue to vnderſtand vnto all thoſe to whom this my Letter, or Edict ſhall come, to be ſéene or read, that George Rochiges Soles, and Rodrigo Dandrades, Atturneys, or Solicitors, of théeſe new Chriſtians, which are dwelling or inhabiting within any of my Realmes, Lordeſhips and Dominions, did earneſtly Requeſt of me, that I ſhould graunt them ſo much fauour, as to Chardge and Commaunde that al ſuch Lawes, Statutes, and Ordinances, which were eſtabliſhed and made by the King my Lorde and Father, which is in Glory, and by other Lordes and Kinges his predeceſſors, touching the new Chriſtians inhabiting and dwelling within the Realme of Portugall, might be quite revoked and made fruſtrate: by which ſaid Lawes, Statutes and Ordinances, the ſaide perſons were prohibited and forbidden that they ſhoulde not departe out of the ſaide Realmes, Dominions and Lordeſhips, without expreſſe Leaue and Licence: and for to ſell their goodes and Landes: whereupon the ſaid Atturneyes or Solicitors for theſe new Chriſtians haue as aforeſaide moſt erneſtly requeſted
and deſired, that from that time forwardes it might be lawfull to and for any of the ſaide new Chriſtians, to depart and go their wayes fréely out of the ſaide Kingdomes Dominions and Lordeſhips, and alſo for to returne backe againe at all times whenſoeuer it ſhall pleaſe them, with their families and goodes, without any offence vnto any perſon: and not to be bounde at any time hereafter, to aſke or demaunde any Leaue or Licenſe at all, and likewiſe that I ſhoulde giue them frée leaue and licenſe to ſell their goodes and Landes at all times when they ſhall thinke méete and convenient for their owne benefit and good. And that from hencefoorth, nor at any time hereafter, there ſhall be any Lawes, Statutes, or Ordinances whatſoeuer, made or ordayned in contradiction of this Edict. And that it woulde pleaſe vs of our gratious fauour and goodnes, to pardon all thoſe perſons whatſoeuer, which haue heeretofore at any time or times, departed out of any of our Kingdomes, Dominions and Lordſhips, and haue ſolde and put away their goodes and Lands contrary to the ſaid former Lawes, Statutes and Ordinances, and alſo that wée ſhoulde Chardge and Commaunde that all ſuch pretentions, accuſations, or moleſtation of them, or any of them, frō this time forwarde ſhall ceaſe. And forasmuch as they do partly knowe the great want which my Treaſury doth ſuſtaine, and the decreaſing of my goodes, and by reaſon of the loyall loue and good will which they beare vnto me, as my true and loyall Subiects: they haue beſtowed vpon me 17050. duccats towardes the Coſt and chardges thereof. And that as touching this Decrée, there might an Edict be made, which may remaine in force, and be eſtabliſhed for a Law, with a Contract irrevocable, and to that intent and purpoſe, that I ſhoulde graunt them their requeſt and petition aforeſaid, they aledged before me, certaine Reaſons and Cauſes to moue me to do the ſame: The which I commaunded to be
ſéene & pervſed, and alſo throughly examined by my lawes and Satutes, before the Lordes of my Royall Councell, and by other wiſe, diſcréet, and wiſe perſonages, throughly and well to examine the ſaide caſe, and to cauſe good proofes to be made thereof, and of ſuch Informations as are néedefull and requiſite. Whereupon, now it doth appeare by thoſe Lawes and accuſations, that the ſaide new Chriſtians haue receiued great Troubles, and ouermuch punniſhment. And in conſideration of this heauy burthen, which they haue carried and ſuſteyned. Wée therefore finde it very conuenient and néedefull, and alſo requiſite for vs to Releaſe them out of this bondage and thralldome, and that it were requiſite it ſhoulde be ſo done and kept for the good gouerment and publique Weale of theſe my Kingdomes and Lordſhipps, and immagining that they will eſtéeme well of this my Gracious •• uour to them in this behalfe extended, and alſo acknowledge them ſelues greatly beholding vnto vs, and that by reaſon of their loyall Loue and Obedience, and many other kinde of Fauours by them ſhewed and done: I do holde it for good and convenient, to Reuoke and vtterly make fruſtrat all thoſe Lawes, Statutes and Ordinances whatſoeuer, wherein it is prohibited that the ſaide new Chriſtians ſhoulde not departe out of my ſaide Realmes, Dominions and Lordeſhips, nor foorth of them, nor to ſel their goodes nor inheritances, without my ſpeciall Licenſe. And therefore I doe Commaunde and will that from hencefoorth they may depart and goe out of my ſaide Realmes with their families & moueables, or wtout them, & that they may returne backe againe at all times, without any moleſting or apprehending of them, and that none ſhal accuſe them for departing out of my ſaide Realmes without leaue or licenſe: And that likewiſe they may ſell their ſaid goodes at all times whenſoeuer they ſhall thinke conuenient, fréely without aſking any leaue or licenſe at all, and
I do further ordaine and holde it for good, that from hence forwardes, thiefe my ſaid Lawes, Statutes & Ordinances, ſhall neuer be Revoked, but to ſtande and abide irreuocable for euer: inſomuch, that I thinke it neceſſarie, for diuers & ſundry cauſes me thereunto mouing: as firſt, for the ſeruice of God, Secondly, for mine Eſtate and Honor, and thirdly for the great benefit and commoditie that may ariſe & come, vnto my ſaide Realmes, Dominions and Lordſhips. And I do likewiſe holde it for good, and it is my will and pleſure fréely, to pardon and forgiue all thoſe which heretofore haue departed and gone away at any time, before the publication of this my Letter of Edict, out of my ſaid Realmes, Dominions and Lordſhips, and haue ſolde their ſaide goodes and inheritances without leaue or licence.

Moreouer, I do ſtrictly commaund and charge, that this Edict nor any part thereof be fruſtrated, nor to procéede in any thing, directly, or indirectly, againſt the ſame, by reaſon of the Demaundes, Cauſes and pretēcions before mentioned, which hath bin done and executed againſt all ſuch as haue bin accuſed, and Condempned, and haue bin tryed by order of law, and paſt in iudgment, ſhall for euer hereafter, ceaſe, and not proceade any further. All which I do Commaunde to be performed, done and kept, by vertue of thiefe my Letters Patents by me now confirmed, Signed, and Sealed with my Royall Saale depending therevnto: The which ſhall ſtande, abide, remaine, continue and be, with all the force, effect, and Vigour of the law, and alſo that the Contractes and agréements herein mencioned and expreſſed for euer hereafter, to be irrevocable: and that all the ſame wholie, ſhal be accompliſhed, performed and kept, in euery degree, according to the true meaning & Contents thereof, without any Trouble, Let, Hindrance, or Imperagement thereof at all.

And further I do deſire and intreat, all thoſe Kinges and
Princes, (my Succeſſors) which hereafter ſhall ſuccéede me, for to accompliſh, maintaine and kéepe this Edict, and alſo to commaunde and cauſe the ſame to be fulfilled & kept, as firmly, and in as lardge and ample manner, as by thiefe my Letters Pattents in all poynts do containe, and according to the whole Contents thereof. And the ſaide 17050 Duccats which is paide by the ſaide new Chriſtians, in that forme and manner afore mentioned in a Scedule of mine, which as concerning this Caſe, I did ſende, and Commaunded it to paſſe, and ſo to be Regiſtred.

closer.dateline: Giuen at Madrill, the Fowerth of Aprill, 1602.

postscript.p: Anthony Fernandis d' Sorſes, did do it in the yeare of our Lorde, 1601. and Anthony Aluares de Senedo, did cauſe this to be Written.
